io.jenetics.prngine

Class LCG64ShiftRandom

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Random
      • io.jenetics.prngine.PRNG
        • io.jenetics.prngine.Random64
          • io.jenetics.prngine.LCG64ShiftRandom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LCG64ShiftRandom.ThreadSafe

    public class LCG64ShiftRandom
extends Random64
    This class implements a linear congruential PRNG with additional bit-shift transition. This is a port of the trng::lcg64_shift PRNG class of the TRNG library created by Heiko Bauke.

    The following listing shows the actual PRNG implementation. 

    
 final long a, b = <params>
 long r = <seed>

 long nextLong() {
     r = q*r + b;

     long t = r;
     t ^= t >>> 17;
     t ^= t << 31;
     t ^= t >>> 8;
     return t;
 }

    Not that the base implementation of the LCG64ShiftRandom class is not thread-safe. If multiple threads requests random numbers from this class, it must be synchronized externally. Alternatively you can use the thread-safe implementations LCG64ShiftRandom.ThreadSafe or LCG64ShiftRandom.ThreadLocal.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Franz Wilhelmstötter
    See Also:
    TRNG, Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LCG64ShiftRandom.Param
      Parameter class for the LCG64ShiftRandom generator, for the parameters a and b of the LC recursion ri+1 = a · ri + b mod 264.
      static class  LCG64ShiftRandom.ThreadLocal
      This class represents a thread local implementation of the LCG64ShiftRandom PRNG.
      static class  LCG64ShiftRandom.ThreadSafe
      This is a thread safe variation of the this PRNG—by synchronizing the random number generation.

      static int SEED_BYTES

        public long nextLong()

        public void setSeed(long seed)

      • split

        public void split(int p,
                  int s)
        Changes the internal state of the PRNG in a way that future calls to nextLong() will generated the sth sub-stream of pth sub-streams. s must be within the range of [0, p-1). This method is mainly used for parallelization via leap-frogging.
        Parameters:
        p - the overall number of sub-streams
        s - the sth sub-stream
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if p < 1 || s >= p.

      • jump2

        public void jump2(int s)
        Changes the internal state of the PRNG in such a way that the engine jumps 2s steps ahead.
        Parameters:
        s - the 2s steps to jump ahead.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if s < 0.

      • jump

        public void jump(long step)
        Changes the internal state of the PRNG in such a way that the engine jumps s steps ahead.
        Parameters:
        step - the steps to jump ahead.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if s < 0.
